Nerangs.ab: ka ǰīw gīrēd ā-š be hassārīh ī gōspand šawišn u-š abestāg
"When one takes the ǰīwām one has to go near the animal and (recite) the abestāg..."

nirang ǧām doḫtan naḫost gāv yā gusfand āvordan yā be galle-ye išān šodan va ǧāmdān rā se bār b-āb pādyāvi šostan va dast be gāv nahādan aṣ̌əm vohū se goftan frauuarāne gāh ānče bid gə̄uš tašne gə̄uš urune tauua gə̄uš huδā̊ŋhō urune xšnaoθra y. v. x. f. yaϑā ahū vairiiō zaotā tā mraotū agar do bid gə̄uš tašne gə̄uš urune yauuākəm gə̄uš huδā̊ŋhō urune xšnaoθra y. v. x. f. agar se bid yaϑā ahū vairiiō zaotā OD mraotū

"The instruction for milking the ǧām is, first, to bring a cow or a sheep or to go to a herd of these animals, to wash three times the ǧāmdān with pādyāb-water. He should put the hand on the cow, recite three Aṣ̌əm Vohūs and the frauuarāne with the corresponding gāh (with the šnūman) gə̄uš tašne gə̄uš urune tauua gə̄uš huδā̊ŋhō urune xšnaoθra. y. v. x. f. and the wāz-gīrišnīh) from yaϑā ahū vairiiō zaotā until mraotū. If (the cows) are two, then gə̄uš tašne gə̄uš urune yauuākəm gə̄uš huδā̊ŋhō urune xšnaoθra. y. v. x. f. If (the cows) are three, then gə̄uš tašne gə̄uš urune yūšmākəm gə̄uš huδā̊ŋhō urune xšnaoθra. y. v. x. f. Then, (the wāz-gīrišnīh) yaϑā ahū vairiiō zaotā until mraotū."

nirang ǧām gereftan ǧāmdān pādyāv kardan va porr-e āb kardan va be ān āb pestān-e gāv yā gusfand šostan va dast-e rāst be pestān gereftan va ǧāmdān be-dast-e čab gereftan be payvand-e dast-e rāst xšnaōθra ahurahe mazdā̊ aṣ̌əm vohū se goftan frauuarāne gāh āne bid agar gāv yā gusfand yek bid gə̄uš tašne gə̄uš urune tauua gə̄uš urune tauua gə̄uš huδā̊ŋhō urune xšnaoθra yasnāi v. x. f. agar do bid gə̄uš tašne gə̄uš urune yauuākəm gə̄uš huδā̊ŋhō urune xšnaoθra yas v. x. f. agar se bid yā galle bid gə̄uš tašne gə̄uš urune yūšmākəm gə̄uš huδā̊ŋhō urune xšnaoθra yas. v. x. f. yaθā ahū vairiiō zaōtā tā sar goftan

"The instruction for taking the milk. He should clean the ǧāmdān, fill it with water and wash with this water the breasts of the udder of the cow or sheep and take the udder with the right hand and the ǧāmdān with the left one. While touching (the udder) with the rigth hand, he should recite the frauuarāne with the corresponding gāh and (with the following šnūman, if the cow or sheep are only one: gə̄uš tašne gə̄uš urune tauua gə̄uš huδā̊ŋhō urune xšnaoθra. y. v. x. f.; if they are two, gə̄uš urune yauuākəm gə̄uš huδā̊ŋhō urune xšnaoθra until fra(sastaiiaēca); if they are three or a herd, gə̄uš tašne gə̄uš urune yūšmākəm gə̄uš huδā̊ŋhō urune xšnaoθra until fra(sastaiiaēca). He should then recite yaϑā ahū vairiiō zaotā until the end."

Quotations.ab: ka ǰīw gīrēd ā-š be hassārīh ī gōspand šawišn u-š abestāg pad hassārīh ī gōspand gōwišn aṣ̌əm vohū sē frauuarānē čē gāh dārēd gə̄uš tašne gə̄uš urune ka ēk tauua gə̄uš hudā̊ŋhō urune ka dō ẏauuākəm gə̄uš ka-š abēr juttar nēst xšnaoθra u-š wāz frāz gīrišn

"When one takes the ǰīwām one has to go near the animal and recite the abestāg near the animal: three Aṣ̌əm Vohū and the Frauuarānē with the corresponding gāhand (with the šnūman) gə̄uš tašne gə̄uš urune (completed with) tauua gə̄uš hudā̊ŋhō urune, when (he takes it only from) one (animal); (with) ẏauuākəm gə̄uš, when (from) two; it is not different, when (he takes is from) more than one, and (closed by) xšnaoθra. He has then to take the wāz."
